definition: to fall out with sb/to become hostile
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
face/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
to fall out with sb and become hostile

sentences.english: Because wang turned against apple shen heart of wang jian.
sentences.chinese: 因爲王蘋蘋沈心對王建翻臉。

sentences.english: M MengFei turned again because with Chen.
sentences.chinese: 徐峯與孟菲因陳超再次翻臉。

sentences.english: Yet China quickly upended this consensus.
sentences.chinese: 然而中國很快就翻臉了。

sentences.english: If they break this sacred rule, you must turn upon them with the Wrath of Hell(tm).
sentences.chinese: 如果他們違反了這神聖的規定，就和他們翻臉吧。

sentences.english: The junior immediately turned his attention to the hardwood.
sentences.chinese: 初中馬上翻臉不認他注意硬木。

sentences.english: What have I done to you? I declare that I am perplexed.
sentences.chinese: 我聲明要翻臉了，你得和我言歸於好。

sentences.english: WHEN your own lawyers turn on you, things must be serious.
sentences.chinese: 當你的律師也與你翻臉的時候，事態一定很嚴重。

sentences.english: YiMing finally decided to put KuErBan and Martha turned to query.
sentences.chinese: 伊明終於決定放了庫爾班，並與前來質問的瑪莎翻臉。

sentences.english: Cloud son also wrote a letter, brazen and left over the camp.
sentences.chinese: 雲子也寫了一封信，悍然與營左翻臉。

sentences.english: Eg : My girlfriend gets snippy when I tell her I'm going out with the boys .
sentences.chinese: 當我告訴女友要去和哥們出去時，她當既就翻臉了。

sentences.english: The best friend a man has in the world may turn against him and become his enemy.
sentences.chinese: 人在世界上最好的朋友可能會翻臉成仇。

definition: to sb's face/in sb's presence
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to be softhearted/to be tenderhearted/to be kindhearted
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
to cease to be faithful
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
no cause, no reason (idiom); completely uncalled for
to recognize people (of babies)/to be able to tell people apart
to reckon/to calculate/to plan/to expect/to scheme
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
to lay one's cards on the table
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to break off relations/to break with sb
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
unpleasant talk/malicious words
